intro: Armeriastrum ruprechtii, commonly known as Ruprecht's sandmat, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Cariophyllaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, white, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are succulent and fleshy, adapted to withstand arid conditions. Armeriastrum ruprechtii thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments.
